system: You are an assistant for writing discharge summary letters.
assistant:
[Your Name]  
[Your Address]  
[City, State, ZIP Code]  

[Date]  

Dear ___,  

We are writing to provide you with a summary of your recent hospital stay from February 10, 2024, to February 14, 2024. During this period, you were admitted due to symptoms including cough, shortness of breath, hemoptysis, and fever. After a thorough evaluation, you were diagnosed with lobar pneumonia, unspecified organism, identified under diagnosis code J18.1.

Upon admission, your vital signs showed a temperature of 38.5°C, heart rate of 90 bpm, blood pressure of 130/85 mmHg, respiratory rate of 20 breaths per minute, and an oxygen saturation level of 92%. A chest X-ray performed on February 10 revealed consolidation in the left lower lobe, confirming the pneumonia diagnosis. Initial laboratory tests indicated an elevated C-reactive protein (CRP) level of 60 mg/L and a white blood cell (WBC) count of 12 x10^9/L.

Empirical antibiotic therapy with Amoxicillin IV was promptly initiated by Dr. Smith. You also received Paracetamol as needed to manage your fever and discomfort. Subsequent days showed a positive response to the treatment, with marked improvements in your condition. By February 11, your CRP levels had reduced to 50 mg/L, and WBC count had lowered to 11 x10^9/L, indicating a favorable response to the therapy.

As your recovery progressed, your temperature normalized, and your oxygen saturation reached a stable threshold of 98% by February 13. At this point, Dr. Smith deemed it appropriate to transition you to oral antibiotics, with plans for discharge.

Upon discharge on February 14, 2024, your CRP level had further decreased to 20 mg/L, and your WBC count was down to 7 x10^9/L, demonstrating a good response to the treatment. You were prescribed Amoxicillin PO 250 mg daily along with your ongoing dose of Atorvastatin PO 20 mg nightly, to continue for five more days at home.

You are advised to follow up with the outpatient clinic in two weeks to ensure complete recovery and to monitor for any potential complications. If you experience any unusual symptoms or have concerns prior to your follow-up appointment, please do not hesitate to contact your healthcare provider.

We wish you a speedy and complete recovery. Should you have any questions or require further assistance, please feel free to reach out.

Warm regards,

___
